TopicTitle: How to have more than one KSP folder with steam?

Articles.Content:
Hello, I usually don't play with mods, but sometimes they are required for specific things.

I would like to know how to have more than one KSP folder so i can mess up with one's saves, config files and mods but keep the main one untouched.

I tried copying it to the desktop but didn't seem to work, got a black screen when tried to open the game.
Copy it, and launch the game from inside the folder. Steam won't work, but KSP will.

Copy the KSP folder to another location, not the desktop. You can even copy it to your data file or another drive. Just run the exe file or create a shortcut to run from there.

"Copy it, and launch the game from inside the folder. Steam won't work, but KSP will. "

Creating a shortcut to the Steam folder version only runs the Steam copy without Steam. If you want to experiment with mods, you should do that to a copy of KSP in case something corrupts the game.

Not to bump this or anything, but did this work tetryds? I also want to have multiple installs with different mods, but still can't figure out how to do this. When i copied the steam folder of KSP to a new folder, it completely moved it out of Steam. Luckily, i moved it back to Steam. While it was in the folder, it still had the orginal mods. How do i copy KSP to a new folder from Steam so that i can install other mods, without effecting the first copy?

From windows explorer (or the equivalent in Mac or Linux) you should just be able to right click on the Kerbal Space Program icon and choose copy, then go to a different location, not inside the steam folder, right click and choose paste. Then in this new location right click on KSP (application) and choose new short cut, name it KSP Mod or something. If you still have trouble let me know and I'll give you a step by step.

Edit: I just did this works fine, I now have two instances KSP running at the same time. Don't forget to drag the shortcut to your desktop.
